ai-mn108:25.4_0: “I hope the Bamboo Grove is delightful, quiet and still, far from the madding crowd, remote from human settlements, and fit for retreat?”

ai-mn108:25.6_0: “Surely, Master Ānanda, it is owing to the venerables who meditate, making a habit of meditating.
ai-mn108:25.7_0: For the venerables do in fact meditate and make a habit of meditating.
ai-mn108:25.8_0: This one time, Master Ānanda, Master Gotama was staying near Vesālī, at the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.
ai-mn108:25.9_0: So I went there to see him.
ai-mn108:25.10_0: And there he spoke about meditation in many ways.
ai-mn108:25.11_0: He meditated, and made a habit of meditating.
ai-mn108:25.12_0: And he praised all kinds of meditation.”
